Post.title: FLUX
Post._content:
### FLUX

---
> Flux is the application architecture that Facebook uses for building client-side web applications. It complements React's composable view components by utilizing a unidirectional data flow. It's more of a pattern rather than a formal framework, and you can start using Flux immediately without a lot of new code.

> React  MVC  V  Flux  M  C 

** Flux :**
- **the dispatcher** ,Store
- **the stores** 
- **the views React**  controller-views
- **the actions**  dispatcher  store

#### 

```
graph LR
Action --> Dispatcher
Dispatcher --> Store
Store --> View
```

 View  Action
![image](http://wiki.jikexueyuan.com/project/react-tutorial/images/flux-overview.png)

-  action action creator  Action  dispatcher
- View  onClick Action
- Dispatcher  Action  Store 
- Store  Action  change  View 
- View  change  setState  UI

** Store  Action **

Post.title: Mysql
Post._content:
## Mysql 

### 
```
SHOW PLUGINS ;
-- partitionactive
```

### 
mysql
1. RANGERANGE

2. LIST

3. COLUMNSCOLUMNSRANGELISTCOLUMNSCOLUMNSRANGELIST

4. HASHHASHHASH

5. KEYtextBLOB,keyhashkey

### 
1. 
```
ALTER TABLE tablename
REMOVE PARTITIONING ;
-- removedrop PARTITION
```
2. range
```
ALTER TABLE `tb_partition`.`tb_varchar` 
PARTITION BY RANGE(id) PARTITIONS 3( PARTITION part0 VALUES LESS THAN (5000),  PARTITION part1 VALUES LESS THAN (10000),  PARTITION part2 VALUES LESS THAN (MAXVALUE)) ;
-- 
```
3. , hash2n
```
ALTER TABLE `tb_partition`.`tb_varchar` PARITION BY KEYS(cp1,cp2,cp3) PARITIONS 8 
```

### 
RANGELISTHASHKEY
```
CREATE TABLE tb_sub (id INT, purchased DATE)
    PARTITION BY RANGE( YEAR(purchased) )
    SUBPARTITION BY HASH( TO_DAYS(purchased) )
    SUBPARTITIONS 2 (
        PARTITION p0 VALUES LESS THAN (1990),
        PARTITION p1 VALUES LESS THAN (2000),
        PARTITION p2 VALUES LESS THAN MAXVALUE
    );
```

Post._content:
## Common
### npm
```shell

npm config set proxy http://127.0.0.1:1080
# "-"  "_"
npm config set https-proxy http://127.0.0.1:1080

```

### git
```shell
git config --global http.proxy 'socks5://127.0.0.1:1080'

git config --global https.proxy 'socks5://127.0.0.1:1080'
```

## UBUNTU
---
1.  
```
$ sudo vi /etc/environment 
 
http_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
https_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
ftp_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
no_proxy="localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" 
HTTP_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
HTTPS_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
FTP_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
NO_PROXY="localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" 
```
2. gtk3  
```
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy mode 'manual' 
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy.http host 'myproxy.server.com' 
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy.http port 8080 
```
3. apt-get  
```
$ sudo vi /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/95proxies 
 
Acquire::http::proxy "http://myproxy.server.com:8080/"; 
Acquire::ftp::proxy "ftp://myproxy.server.com:8080/"; 
Acquire::https::proxy "https://myproxy.server.com:8080/";
```
4. git  
	* http  https 
   ```
   git config --global http.proxy http://myproxy.server.com:8080 
   git config --global https.proxy https://myproxy.server.com:8080 
   ```
	* git://    
    ```
    $ sudo apt-get install socat 
    $ sudo vi /usr/bin/gitproxy 
    -------------------------- 
    #!/bin/bash 

    PROXY=myproxy.server.com 
    PROXYPORT=8080 
    PROXYAUTH=username:password 
    exec socat STDIO PROXY:$PROXY:$1:$2,proxyport=$PROXYPORT,proxyauth=$PROXYAUTH 
    -------------------------- 
    $ sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/gitproxy 
    $ git config --global core.gitproxy gitproxy
    ```

## Common
### npm
```shell

npm config set proxy http://127.0.0.1:1080
# "-"  "_"
npm config set https-proxy http://127.0.0.1:1080

```

### git
```shell
git config --global http.proxy 'socks5://127.0.0.1:1080'

git config --global https.proxy 'socks5://127.0.0.1:1080'
```

## UBUNTU
---
1.  
```
$ sudo vi /etc/environment 
 
http_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
https_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
ftp_proxy=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
no_proxy="localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" 
HTTP_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
HTTPS_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
FTP_PROXY=http://myproxy.server.com:8080/ 
NO_PROXY="localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" 
```
2. gtk3  
```
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy mode 'manual' 
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy.http host 'myproxy.server.com' 
gsettings set org.gnome.system.proxy.http port 8080 
```
3. apt-get  
```
$ sudo vi /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/95proxies 
 
Acquire::http::proxy "http://myproxy.server.com:8080/"; 
Acquire::ftp::proxy "ftp://myproxy.server.com:8080/"; 
Acquire::https::proxy "https://myproxy.server.com:8080/";
```
4. git  
	* http  https 
   ```
   git config --global http.proxy http://myproxy.server.com:8080 
   git config --global https.proxy https://myproxy.server.com:8080 
   ```
	* git://    
    ```
    $ sudo apt-get install socat 
    $ sudo vi /usr/bin/gitproxy 
    -------------------------- 
    #!/bin/bash 

    PROXY=myproxy.server.com 
    PROXYPORT=8080 
    PROXYAUTH=username:password 
    exec socat STDIO PROXY:$PROXY:$1:$2,proxyport=$PROXYPORT,proxyauth=$PROXYAUTH 
    -------------------------- 
    $ sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/gitproxy 
    $ git config --global core.gitproxy gitproxy
    ```

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)
Post.raw:
---
title: Hello World
---
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Post.title: Fastdfs
Post._content:
## 
 https://github.com/happyfish100/() fastdfslibfastcommonfastdfs-nginx-module
## 
1. gccgcc
```
yum install -y gcc gcc-c++
```
2. FastDFSlibevent
```
yum -y install libevent
```
3. nginx
```
yum install gcc-c++
yum install -y pcre pcre-devel
yum install -y zlib zlib-devel
yum install -y openssl openssl-devel
```
## fastdfs
./make.sh ,  ./make.sh install
## tracker
1.  /etc/fdfs fastdfs
2.  cp tracker.conf.sample tracker.conf
3.  
	1.1 base_path=/home/yuqing/fastdfs  base_path=/data/fastdfs
4. /etc/init.d/fdfs_trackerd start
## storage
1.  
```
cp tracker.conf.sample tracker.conf
```
2.  
	2.1 *base_path=/home/yuqing/fastdfs*  *base_path=/data/fastdfs/storage*
	2.2 *store_path0=/home/yuqing/fastdfs*  *store_path0=/data/fastdfs/storage*
	2.3 *tracker_server=192.168.209.121:22122*  *IP:22122*
3. /etc/init.d/fdfs_storage start
## 
1. fastdfs 2212223000
## 
1.  cp client.conf.sample client.conf
2. 
	2.1 *base_path=/home/yuqing/fastdfs*  *base_path=/data/fastdfs*
	2.2 *tracker_server=192.168.0.197:22122*  *IP:22122*
3. /usr/bin/fdfs_upload_file /etc/fdfs/client.conf upload /img/test.jpg
## nginx
1. fastdfs-nginx-module 
	1.1  fastdfs-nginx-module  /usr/local/
	1.2  fastdfs-nginx-module/src/config, 
		* ngx_module_incs="/usr/include/fastdfs /usr/include/fastcommon/"
		* CORE_INCS="$CORE_INCS /usr/include/fastdfs /usr/include/fastcommon/"
2. nginx fastdfs-nginx-module
	2.1 nginx
	2.2 nginx 
	```
	./configure --add-module=../fastdfs-nginx-module-master/src
	```
	2.3 nginx
	```
	make && make install
	```
4. nginxfastdfs-nginx-module
	4.1  fastdfs-nginx-module conf/mod_fastdfs.conf  /etc/fdfs/ 
		* base_path=/tmp  base_path=/data/fastdfs
		* tracker_server=tracker:22122  tracker_server= :22122
		* store_path0=/home/yuqing/fastdfs  store_path0=/data/fastdfs/storage
		* url_have_group_name=false  url_have_group_name=true
	4.2  fastdfs conf/http.confconf/mime.types  /etc/fdfs/
5. nginx
	5.1  /usr/local/nginx/config/nginx.config ,
		```
		location /group1/M00/{
				ngx_fastdfs_module;
		}
		```
	5.2 nginx /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx

##

1. gccgcc
```

```
2. FastDFSlibevent
```
yum -y install libevent
```
3. nginx
```
yum install gcc-c++
yum install -y pcre pcre-devel
yum install -y zlib zlib-devel
yum install -y openssl openssl-devel

## fastdfs

## tracker

2.  cp tracker.conf.sample tracker.conf

	1.1 base_path=/home/yuqing/fastdfs  base_path=/data/fastdfs
4. /etc/init.d/fdfs_trackerd start

```

2.

3. /usr/bin/fdfs_upload_file /etc/fdfs/client.conf upload /img/test.jpg
## nginx
1. fastdfs-nginx-module 
	1.1  fastdfs-nginx-module  /usr/local/

2. nginx fastdfs-nginx-module

		* base_path=/tmp  base_path=/data/fastdfs

		* store_path0=/home/yuqing/fastdfs  store_path0=/data/fastdfs/storage
		* url_have_group_name=false  url_have_group_name=true
	4.2  fastdfs conf/http.confconf/mime.types  /etc/fdfs/
5. nginx
	5.1  /usr/local/nginx/config/nginx.config ,
		```
		location /group1/M00/{
				ngx_fastdfs_module;
		}
		```
	5.2 nginx /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx
